website_summaries.verdict: A very fast machine, producing extremely high-quality printing, particularly when duplexing.
cons: If you want anything other than letter or legal size, you'll have to feed it by hand through the manual bypass slot

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Requires the "fine" print setting for a good print. But I'll take that over alternatives because it uses little ink which is reasonably priced. I like the wireless much and the ability to print large (11x17) pages.
customer_reviews.author: Ben McLachlan

customer_reviews.title: Love the nfc function
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! The nfc function is amazing! I use the brother iprint app on my phone and the nfc function to print everything I need. Update: I just wanted to add that this printer prints full color copies SUPER fast! I have never had a printer that prints 8.5x11 color pages so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lingerfelt

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating Experience!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in May of 2016. It had a 2 year warrantee. The printer was used by only me and not heavily. After spending two days with no help from Brother support online chat or 7 local IT repair shops I started shopping for a new printer. The periodic issues were: printer arrived with clogged ink jets, the 4x6 photos were smeared and had black lines, almost always the first few prints were unusable. Hours of my time were wasted waiting on phone hold for "training" to deal with the Brother initial set up and quirks. I used only Brother brand inks. The final disaster was no-power-to-printer in the middle of a large photo scanning to file project.
customer_reviews.author: Rabid

customer_reviews.title: Another Brother, again and again
customer_reviews.text: This model is a replacement for a MFCJ4410DW which I've had for a few years and loved it. A relative was looking for a printer so I gave her that one and bought this 4620 to replace it. I have to say that I love it as much if not more. I've had virtually every brand of printer, Canon, HP, epson etc etc. over the years and though they were mostly very good, I would take the Brother over them all.
customer_reviews.author: Arns

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer with great features!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for over a year now and It has been the best printer I have owned to date. I'd normally go for HP printers but wanted to try something different because of the great deals on Amazon for compatible ink. Before purchasing I was skeptical because of a few negative reviews but from my personal experience this printer is affordable and a great choice and I would recommend this printer to anyone. Also reading the instructions and being aware of your printer model when purchasing ink will save you a lot of headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Mims

customer_reviews.title: Will only work until the first ink crtridege replacement.  Have owned two, both with the same problem.  JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: The second of these printers I've purchased. They did not lost two years on either. Same issue with both. Worked well out of the box, but once you have to change ink cartridges, that's it. Poor printing with color very pale or not flowing the ink at all. When you run the maintenance cleaning to correct, it uses up all of your ink, as both printers required multiple cleanings, as directed by the on-screen guidance to correct the problem. A piece of junk you will hate owning.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Michael

customer_reviews.title: Trying to fix a connection problem
customer_reviews.text: I am having a problem with the printer staying online. It keeps going to sleep and then won't wake up when asked to print by WIFI. Update 1-14-18; After using their provided CD I still could not get the Brother prsinter to wake up. I had to call their support line and they finally walked me thru a procedure to program the Brother printer to wake up on demand to print. When I asked why the CD didn't do this simple task I got an answer like , "it was too complicated for the CD to do it for every operating system." DUH
customer_reviews.author: Luanne K Shaw

customer_reviews.title: What's the one thing you really need from a printer?
customer_reviews.text: Styling on this Brother printer is good and the tilt screen for controls is great. But the most difficult thing about it (and the thing that should be the easiest) is controlling the PRINT QUALITY. I've had this for 6 weeks and still cannot find out how to make it print anything better than what would have been fast draft on my HP printers. It has so many features that will never be useful, but the one I need seems hidden. Or it just doesn't print well. (I find this hard to believe and have to think IM doing something wrong, but...) Oh, Brother, Where art thou print quality controls?
customer_reviews.author: ritch holben

customer_reviews.title: This is the best printer I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer I've ever owned. Very user friendly & reliable. Good quality. It has made my life much easier. Love the document feeder ! I have 1 more thing I need to print that may be a challenge, but I'm pretty sure I can figure it out. and if I can't I will call customer support -- I've heard they're very helpful -- not had to try them out yet. Excellent quality for the price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Queeny65

customer_reviews.title: Brother Business Smart MFC-J4620DW Inkjet...
customer_reviews.text: . I'm very happy with this printer. It prints very well and fast on the Wi-Fi network. I bought this printer as a replacement for Brother WorkSmart MFC-J880DW Compact All-in-One Inkjet Printer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A.

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED REVIEW: THE worst printer I ever bought. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I had to updated my review because I am so frustrated and angry for wasting my money on this junk. It no longer prints. Jobs sent either are delayed or it ejects blank paper. I've even tried printing off a flash drive and it won't recognize jpeg files. It worked for maybe three months top. That was in April 2016. I have to recycle this because it's just complete garbage. First time and last time a purchaser of a Brother printer. Original review: Output of colors are dull and dreary.
customer_reviews.author: D E

customer_reviews.title: the print (simple drafting and text based doc) quality seems very nice to me as are the scanning elements
customer_reviews.text: As I am a Mac user running OS X I am only giving this 4 stars because although this printer is touted by Brother as being compatible, it was a week long ordeal to get the correct configuration. That said, once installed, the print (simple drafting and text based doc) quality seems very nice to me as are the scanning elements. It certainly helps that the ink replacements are economical. I would recommend this to a Windows user easily but not for5 OS X unless you have lots of extra time on your hands.
customer_reviews.author: dedos23

customer_reviews.title: Certainly Excellent for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it five stars, particularly with such a nice price, but the print quality is mediocre, but satisfactory for my needs. I find the scanner _does_ work nicely from programs that are Win7 compatible... my old original flavor Paint Shop Pro 8 barfs on scanning, but I like PSP Pro well enough to upgrade to PSP Pro X8 to solve that problem. Some reviewers complained that it isn't twain-compliant, but it sure acts like it when scanning from within Foxit PhantomPDF.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I received this amazing printer just in time to help my friend print ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this amazing printer just in time to help my friend print and send some documents for the UC she's attending. My husband usually sets up our electronics because lets be honest set up is usually the most frustrating part. He left for work and my friend needed it done ASAP so we went ahead and gave it a go. It was seriously the best experience I've had. Super simple. I was able to set up print out and scan to email back her documents in less then an hour!! LOVE this printer!
customer_reviews.author: LaurenAM

customer_reviews.title: Installation was simple and the printer works great right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the printer to have an economical wide format printer capable of printing on 11'x17" paper. Installation was simple and the printer works great right out of the box. It is faster than I imagined for its attractive price. I am not one to be pleasantly surprise but the printer pleasantly surprised me. I read about the high cost of ink, but I have not had to purchase any yet.
customer_reviews.author: MrTed

customer_reviews.title: READ FIRST BEFORE BUYING FOR LARGE FORMATE PRINTING!!!
customer_reviews.text: Although this printer does technically handle large format paper (tabloid) do not be fooled by all the descriptions of how fast or business oriented this printer is with regards to printing large format. 8.5" x 11" paper is a breeze, no issues. For the larger paper you can only load one sheet at a time!!! into an inconveniently place slot in the back. And the movable guides on the back tray are so delicate and easy to move that simply loading the paper will move them causing your printout to be askew. I had to hot-glue mine in place in order for the paper to feed straight!!! I do not recommend this for anyone who wishes to print large formate.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Design & Build

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking this printer. My first dive into the Brother brand and I'm glad I tried it. The printer as a whole seems to be tidier and more thought out than equal competitors I researched or have owned (HP, Canon, etc). It has really nice features for smartphones and easy to use interface. I had the thing up and going in less than 20 min (fully boxed to test sheet printed). So far these trainer cartridges have printed over 50 sheets (color/black) and still going strong. I am going to try the extra capacity cartridges at my first but, main reason to get the printer really.
customer_reviews.author: Sandsman

customer_reviews.title: The colors it prints are extremely dull and faded and the lack of ability to color ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely should not be sold as a "photo printer". The colors it prints are extremely dull and faded and the lack of ability to color correct is extremely frustrating. I've wasted so much ink and paper trying to get prints that don't look terrible but no luck. 2 stars because it works fine as a document printer but it's obviously not what I bought the thing for.
customer_reviews.author: Steff Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Affordable with a few caveats
customer_reviews.text: The standard landscape 8.5x11 paper bin is nice and an alternative single sheet feeder handles index cards to legal sheets. Jams have been very rare and usually user errors. The ink cartridges are sufficient for our usage. The printer automatically orders new cartridges in advance of the need.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: First Brother product and very happy thus far. Easy to set up and had all functions ready in about 30 minutes.No problems with the wireless/network printing. Items printed were legible and clear. Came with starter inks and should be plenty for us for quite a few copies/ printing. Shipped quickly and packed securely.
customer_reviews.author: K.D. COCHRAN

customer_reviews.title: Prints from any device at any time while connected over ...
customer_reviews.text: Prints from any device at any time while connected over wifi. If anyone comes to our house and needs to print something all they have to do is connect to the wifi and the printer shows up on their iphone or ipad. If you are looking for a home printer, stop, buy this one your search is over.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: After 2.5 years, the black ink nozzle is finally dying. I am disappointed with the Brother quality since their laser line of printers is very good. Even though the printer was slow and had an average print quality (no connectivity issues), I did a decent amount of printing. It saves you money on ink while it lasts, but Epson and Cannon printers have a superior quality control.
customer_reviews.author: sweet

customer_reviews.title: High quality and function for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and easy to use. Everything you love about Brother comes with this MFC. Just know the 11x17 function is one sheet at a time when printing. Overall A+
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: So bad, I would never order another Brother Printer
customer_reviews.text: Had terrible problems with connecting the printer to standard WiFi. Low printer cartridges prevented printer from printing until changed, but no notification that was necessary. Final straw that broke the camel's back was it completely died, while still under warranty. Then Brother came up with some "new policies" which according to them meant that they did not have to honor their warranty. I used to be a loyal Brother customer, but NO MORE!!
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer to replace a Canon all-in-one which used up most of the ink during the frequent "cleaning" cycles it was always performing. For the money, this printer is very good, and suits our needs perfectly. It connects to our network flawlessly and always works when we need it to, and best of all, it uses a lot less ink than our Canon, which we only used a few times before it went to the dump. From now on, we will buy Brother printers until they too, go to the printer dark side.
customer_reviews.author: groundhog

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product; highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I have ever invested in. It's versatile and has many settings I can work with. Because I work with B4-size paper, it was nice to see it had a scanner that could accommodate that. I am very pleased with this after having dealt with so many similar ones that were more or less toasters with the option to print. This has surpassed all expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Lycantis

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: It prints in reverse, who ever was allowed to design a printer like this should be fired. If you don't want to manually collate everything you print you will need to define print in reverse in software. FYI, google cloud print does not offer print in reverse, if you intend in using that you better like collating. Also the paper try is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my home office, works perfectly and printed copies are good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Setting up my home office for my new job that I would work remotely was stressful enough. But finding this printer, scanner, copier and fax machine was the best purchase ever and WORKS! I actually scanned my contracts after printing them and email them back to my employer. Great choice too and printing quality is good and works remotely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: making it completely useless. Returned and got and Epson which works beautifully
customer_reviews.text: When I replaced the ink it would not recognize the new ink. It then would also not recognize the old ink cartridges, making it completely useless. Returned and got and Epson which works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Quality doesn't match reviews
customer_reviews.text: First time to buy a Brother printer. But probably the last time. I've owned 3 Canon printers with great satisfaction. Only Canon's inkjet printers consume alot of ink. That was one of the reasons to buy this printer. Low ink consumption. I haven't found this printer to be much better in that department. I'm the beginning the duplexing, two sided printing, worked. But not now. I'm less than a year of purchasing. Paper jams often. Can not change the printing speed or quality. Slow. The printer can not accommodate 220 volts. Only 110. Time to return to Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Blair

customer_reviews.title: If you want a printer that works occasionally, loses ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want a printer that works occasionally, loses connection with your computer often, and can't print without some type of error, this is the printer for you. A small child with a crayon would be more reliable than this printer.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your time,terrible. Spent hours following the trouble shooting advice on the Brother website. Deleted and installed the print drivers three times. Thought I had it fixed, then it still would not print, but it did cycle through 30 pages of paper over a half hour, printing nothing at all on those pages. Fortunately we bought the service plan, then we were told oh we will repair it or replace it. Sorry I do not wish to see another Brother printer again.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer.. way to go Brother!
customer_reviews.text: Had a bad experience with Brother printers years ago, so I was hesitant to try them again. Really had no choice since my "go to" has been Canon and all they make now it garbage. This new Brother printer has done everything I've asked of it and passed with flying colors! Very glad I decided to give them another change (and get rid of Canon in the process)!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has problems connecting to and printing from Apple computers on home network. It continually is caught in a loop noting it is printing a document and nothing prints. I cannot perform any functions and cannot shut off. I must unplug the unit. Also I recently tried to copy a simple 8.5 x 11 document manually and using the form feeder and it blank pages came out. I am extremely unhappy with is printer.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S

customer_reviews.title: Great for home office
customer_reviews.text: This printer has served me well. It has all the features I was looking for and the set-up was really easy. I was ready to print within minutes. I really like being able to print from my phone. The quality so far has been good, it doesn't take up much space so perfect for the home office, and it doesn't make a lot of noise. I think it prints as quickly as you can expect a home, desktop printer to print.
customer_reviews.author: MLW

customer_reviews.title: We love this printer so much we bought two!! one for home and one for office
customer_reviews.text: This printer is so easy to use! We love the ability to print from any device. So easy for copies, scan documents, printing. We love it! The ink holds up long, do not have to replace a ton! This is a quality printer !
customer_reviews.author: Paige D.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I would have been happier spending a little more money for what I think ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I would have been happier spending a little more money for what I think would be better quality. It seems it takes forever for the printer to respond after sending the document from the computer. It has a grinding sound which just sounds like poor or cheap mechanisms. But the print is clear and I like that it can do double-sides. I think I got what I paid for so I can't really complain. Haven't had it long enough to comment more.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M. Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Not quality color
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a nice printer for photos, I would not recommend this one. I bought this to replace my Canon Mark ll and it is a real disappointment. It does have more functions than just a printer....but the color photos I printed were dull and "grayish". My old Canon did absolutely beautiful color prints. I guess it depends what you're going to use it for and how quality you want your color prints. I am returning this Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Good printer.
customer_reviews.text: Chose this so I could print 11x17 pages in my office. Print quality, speed, and scanner app are all good. It's a little awkward to feed 11x17 sheets, but not enough to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer that I caught on sale. I have an iPhone on ios 11 and the Air Print function works flawlessly. It prints fairly fast with great results. You won't go wrong with this printer for residential use.
customer_reviews.author: Kratos

customer_reviews.title: Thus far it has worked just fine. I have a Brother HL 1240 LASER printer ...
customer_reviews.text: Thus far it has worked just fine. I have a Brother HL 1240 LASER printer that I've owned since late last century, and it's still working fine at 20-years of age. I hope this inkjet will be as satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Keehn

customer_reviews.title: Wi-fi Connectiivty, Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I swear, I have bad luck with printers. This one though is amazing. I have had great luck so far with this printer. The wireless capability is by far the most important to me, and it is very easy to connect as long as your wi-fi has a good signal. Definitely worth the price. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Natalya Cappellini

customer_reviews.title: so good. I'm still using the ink that came with ...
customer_reviews.text: I've printed about 200 pages worth of scientific research papers with this printer. So far, so good. I'm still using the ink that came with the printer and it looks like the black ink cartridge is about 2/3 full after 200 pages of dense type. It's fast and reliable. I haven't printed photos or anything else with extensive use of colors.
customer_reviews.author: michael z

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly frustrating and complete waste of money and time
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly frustrating and complete waste of money and time: worst ink printer purchase in 20+ years. EVERY OTHER PRINT job whether 1 or 10 pages takes 15-30 minutes to complete given 1.) defective wireless 'mechanism (hardware and/or software)--requiring sometimes multiple printer resets 2) need to clean the ink nozzles EVERYDAY (else prints 100% blank page), even with new ink cartridges. Although computers are within feet of the printer, the wireless software constantly gets hung up on 'Receiving data" status. This prevents the cancel button and power down buttons from working and thus I need to 'reset' the printer by disconnect power from wall, clear the print jobs, power up, request a new print job.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchelina

customer_reviews.title: Ink cartridges hold 5x what others hold and the speed and quality of prints is excellent. Have had 2 of the earlier models in ...
customer_reviews.text: Have always preferred Brother printers over other brands since the late 90's when I had one of the first personal laser printers from brother. Ink cartridges hold 5x what others hold and the speed and quality of prints is excellent. Have had 2 of the earlier models in commercial service now for total of 7+ years with no product issues. Sheet feeders still work perfectly, even for double sided printing & the units almost never jam even with the least expensive copy paper in them.
customer_reviews.author: andrew penko

customer_reviews.title: Brother MFC -J4620 all in one - Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit about a year now, and its the best printer I have owned period. It just keeps going and the wireless connection is flawless. I can print and scan without issue - all wirelessly. The print quality is acceptable and the print speed is more than average for an ink jet printer. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sound man

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints just fine, however, it uses ink cartridges like there's no tomorrow. The sad part is - I rarely use it. I've barely made 100 copies over the two years I've had it & have had to replace the ink cartridges three times. This printer prints nowhere near the copies claimed before having to replace the cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Kaisha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Mac User
customer_reviews.text: If you run a Mac, do not buy. Out of the box this unit would not wirelessly scan despite being able to print via my wi-fe network. After several attempts on my own I spent an additional $39.00 having a printer install service come out and look at the setup. They could get it to work with a cord and plug but not over wi-fi. According to the tech this is a common problem with Brother, they're software simply does not interface well with Apple products. This might work for you if you have a PC, but for mac users, look at Epson or HP options.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN KOBERG

customer_reviews.title: Great 4 function printer.
customer_reviews.text: Most new printers don’t have fax. If you need print, copy, scan and fax, this is a good choice. Not recommended for photos.
customer_reviews.author: personalnjc

customer_reviews.title: this is a good machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: the back paper feeder does not have a paper support guide as noted in the manual that came with the machine or the in the online manual. I called Brother Customer Support to let whoever is in charge of manual writing that this issue needed to be corrected, but to no avail. it was clear that the young lady was reading from a script. When she started asking me specifics about the manual, i.e., page number, which manual, etc. I said I had to leave for an appointment. Therefore, this is a good machine for the price. But, BEWARE if you have to call Customer Support.
customer_reviews.author: kcl

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer isn't very reliable. It needed to be attached directly by cable to my Apple computer--the wireless function was too spotty. You have to plug it in and unplug it all the time so it resets itself to continue printing. That's a real pain when you are printing more than a page pr two. I have had technicians come twice to try to improve its performance. I'm afraid it's just a cheap, inefficient and inadequate piece of equipment. Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lodge

customer_reviews.title: Small Footprint and Light Weight, Perfect for MacBook Soho Use
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for wireless via my MacBook Pro - easy setup, fast double-sided printing & easy scanning - SoHo use. I miss duplex scanning - but for the size price and weight you can't beat this printer. 11x14 printing is truly a gift in this small footprint printer.
customer_reviews.author: sodman

customer_reviews.title: Feature rich and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably easy setup. Product website well layed out well and covers all needs with excellent support. Supplied software has many useful features. Interface to Iphone with brother "iprint & scan" sets itself up easily and works perfectly. Print quality not the best but more than good enough for non professional use. Would highly recommend product.
customer_reviews.author: FEC

customer_reviews.title: Stop the search! This is the printer you've been searching for!
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this product, prints out great photos and printed 200+ pages of documents and haven't used half of black regular catridge yet. I love the fact that the inks cost half of what most of other company's ink and last so much longer. So far it's the best printer I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Busymom

customer_reviews.title: Total reliability, great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is one sweet reliable machine. Bought this five years ago for home /work-at-home use so it's time for a review. It's gotten medium to heavy use with never a problem or even a hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: DH Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Wifi Connection fix
customer_reviews.text: Every time the printer goes to sleep, it loses WiFi connection, and I have to go through the process of setting up WiFi connection to the printer all over. I updated the firmware to no avail. Finally after several google searches, I found the solution. Restart the router. Simple fix! So far, the connection is still active. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: RayR

customer_reviews.title: A very good printer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice printer that has not given me any trouble. The setup as straight forward and had no problems connecting via WIFI. It is not a great photograph printer, but prints standard copies well. The copier portion works without troubles ( I cannot comment on the fax as I have not used it) It is gentle on ink and does self maintenance periodically.
customer_reviews.author: james wiatrowski

customer_reviews.title: Stay away if you want a wireless printer that works with a Mac
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this printer for about 8 months and I'm about to buy a different printer. Here's why: - 9 times out of 10, when I try to print, my computer says "Printer not connected". I have to unplug the printer and plug it back in to get it to "talk" to my computer (a Mac, wireless connection). - the other 1 time out of 10, the printer prints blank pages. If you want a wireless connection with a Mac, I highly recommend NOT buying this. Our previous printer was a Canon and we had no connection problems and very few print-head problems.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont family

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer does everything I need it to and more! Download the Brother app and plug in, you can lay down documents on the ADF and scan directly to your phone. You can print from your phone. You can use your laptop to tell it to scan wireless. Scan resolution is pretty decent. No skewing. I am absolutely satisfied and impressed with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I doubt you'll be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Works as described. Small footprint on the desk. Nice modern design. A bit slow (as I was aware based on other reviews), but for home/office, how fast does it really need to print, am I right? For the price point with all the features it has, it was a worthwhile trade off. The wireless setup was wicked easy and we have Apple, Android, and Microsoft devices all using it to print, with no annoying cables to plug into. The menu screen is easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Piehn

customer_reviews.title: Wifi is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Gave 4 stars instead of 5 because i haven't actually tried printing Photos with yet... so far the bit of color i've used it works great... my favorite feature is the wireless and the app that works with my phone.. I bought it also because of the seperate ink adn the fact it will still print even after one ink is low/runs out unlike a lot of the other brands right now (hp/epson etc)
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgrrlie

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like it....
customer_reviews.text: Once the ink runs out I'm going to sell it or give it away. It just seems to use up ink so fast. I had to print on envelopes one day and I almost threw it out the window because the interface on the touch screen is trash. I gave it an extra star because if you use the mobile functions you can print your pics from your phone it came in handy a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality
customer_reviews.text: Spent an hour on the phone with Brother Support, and all we accomplished was to run it out of ink. Output is always very very light starting day one up till it ran out of ink. Sending it back and probably buying an HP. Brother Ink is less expensive, but when you can not get a good output, cheap ink means nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Did not work wth Apple AirPrint
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Would not print multi-page documents with Apple AirPrint. Driver update fixed this on my MacBook Pro, but it still would not work with iPhones or iPads. The machine also sounded very strange, even for a prInter.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Second one I've purchased and they both work great! Setup can be difficult if your don't have ...
customer_reviews.text: Second one I've purchased and they both work great! Setup can be difficult if your don't have the USB cord, which does NOT come with the printer, which is the only downside that I can think of...
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Fast Printing speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Tough to set up. Instructions unclear. Once in use, a good performer with quick printing speeds. I think It will be a superior product to the various Canon Pixma printers I have had for the last 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Maxmike

customer_reviews.title: Faulty/poor product.
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked only via wire connection. The wireless hardware was faulty and would error out until hard reset. The paper tray holder was also to tight for the correct size paper and the pass through paper feeder in the back had alignment guides that were too loose so the would move when the paper was being pulled in. After dealing with Brother tech support I will not be purchasing Brother products again. This product was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sirin Srikier

customer_reviews.title: BRIEFLY: Since day one I've had continuous problems with ...
customer_reviews.text: BRIEFLY: Since day one I've had continuous problems with installation, printing, wifi connection, printer going offline, repeat issues on and on! I purchased on basis of glowing reviews especially photo quality. I spend more time (significantly more) on phone with Brother Tech Support 10 X's more than I've been able to do anything but make copies! The very few times I've been able to print almost trouble free the photo quality was exceptional! Avoid product!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara F. Guillory

customer_reviews.title: Hooray!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble with other all-in-one printers trying to scan. Either it didn't work or I couldn't find any information on how to make it work. This printer works great and scanning is a snap. I even uploaded some attachments to an Email and believe it or not, I have never been able to do that before. Very nice all-in-one printer.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Osgood

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: really nice machine. works really well with my wireless laptop. I send from my phone while I am out tending business. I would recommend for small offices use.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Hargrave

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Great with wi-fi. Love the fact that the ink is one of the lowest priced inks on the market. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne DeBevoise

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for an old HP printer I had. The HP stopped working once I updated to windows 10. This Bothers printer has small footprint. Very easy to set up. So far, it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: ynsmom

customer_reviews.title: The Brother name is dependable. Works well for my home office needs.
customer_reviews.text: Great for my small space. Print quality is pretty good. Wish I had FAX capability but it’s good for what I’m doing at home.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer j4620dw
customer_reviews.text: Very good printer j4620dw. Saves me a lot of money on ink! Used weekly to print bulletins. Good quality prints even when using ink saver mode.
customer_reviews.author: A L

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this printer. It prints quickly and on both sides of the page without having to do it manually. Sets up easy and it has cloud print and air printing capabilities. It is big but has many features.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Egan

customer_reviews.title: dissappointing
customer_reviews.text: wifi took 5mins to print a very light 1 page pdf file. the first day was super fast and now very slow. Might be a software issue
customer_reviews.author: behnam

customer_reviews.title: Not super impressed with the print quality but maybe it's the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not super impressed with the print quality but maybe it's the standard paper that I'm using. Seems like the print quality on color print jobs is worse than my laster printer.
customer_reviews.author: shane ambro

customer_reviews.title: This is one printer that can be used for Home too!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a techie and I'm in love with this printer. The ability to print from my tablet and be able to do 2 sided printing without having to get up and with medical problems thus helps a lot. It has a quiet mode so my husband can be doing his thing and I can pay bills and print receipts.
customer_reviews.author: AuburnTigers52

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRINTER.  Only scans letter size.
customer_reviews.text: The way it was worded, I thought the SCANNER was also 11 x 17, not just the printer.
customer_reviews.author: David Campiti

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Complicated, not intuitive After market ink difficult "Spits" out blank pages along with printed pages
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M. Shakir

customer_reviews.title: I like this printer a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer a lot. I bought it because it said it printed really fast. I don't know what I"m doing wrong but it prints really slow. It's kind of loud, but it very nicely built and I love the horizontal print feature which saves space.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Customer

customer_reviews.title: ink recognition issues
customer_reviews.text: it is definitely the worst printer I have ever had, it sometimes doesn't recognize the ink and I've been using genuine ink.
customer_reviews.author: Donver Landy

customer_reviews.title: Price is good. Printer works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Price is good. Printer works as advertised. It is noisy printer compared to anything I've owned before. The scanning feature is good although I haven't used the automatic document feed yet. Still using the ink it came with. After 2 weeks. of ownership, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Steven Kovner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer.
customer_reviews.text: Other than having a bit of difficulty downloading the drivers for the software, I have found the printer to meet expectations in the first few weeks I have had it. Especially impressed with the speed and quality of the print. while it is louder than my old HP it doesn't bother me. I especially like the ability to send everything wirelessly from my computer as well as my wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: james j friedman

customer_reviews.title: Great design.
customer_reviews.text: Third Brother MFC in the family now. Others are 3 & 2 yrs old. All of them work flawlessly. Great design.
customer_reviews.author: D. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: great little printer
customer_reviews.text: great little printer. I was not able to set it up to print wirelessly. I gave up. Love how fast it prints. great quality
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Nice home printer.
customer_reviews.text: Went from an HP to this printer due to other reviews and I am glad I did. This is the most plug and play friendly wireless printer I have ever used. Easy to set up. Good print quality. Did I mention it was easy to set up. The only thing I dont like is the brother software installed on my laptop but considering how much I like this printer it is not a big deal and its not intrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Kwesdog

customer_reviews.title: If you can't get it to print, you'll never know how good it may be.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently if you have upgraded to Windows 10 this printer will not work. FAQ lists a number of gimmicks to try to fool it in to working but I had no success. Brother support is non existent.
customer_reviews.author: Merle W Craner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect home printer that seamlessly connects with your phone or ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect home printer that seamlessly connects with your phone or tablet. My biggest factor in deciding which printer to buy was size (I have a small home office). Highly recommend this printer to anyone who is looking for a quality all-in-one device (printing, scanning, coping) for personal office usage at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: RHoop206

customer_reviews.title: Broke down after less than 200 pages
customer_reviews.text: Less than two hundred pages printed and it broke down. Initially I thought it was a problem with the heads being clogged, but after burning through multiple ink cartridges it seems clear the problem was the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Tordable

customer_reviews.title: fast and now the only printer in my home office
customer_reviews.text: Fast, Easy to configure - I am a Brother fan for many years - this is an exceptional MFC - fast enough to finally sell my laser backup printer.
customer_reviews.author: z89101

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awesome prints really great pictures I absolutely love it .
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Wastes ink
customer_reviews.text: Eats ink. I barely use this printer but the black ink runs out in less than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: vBlaine

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed - should come with a usb cable. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed - should come with a usb cable. Ok - but just nothing really note worthy. Overall impression - FAIR.
customer_reviews.author: pinky

customer_reviews.title: Makes loud screeching sounds when it warms up after 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes loud screeching sounds when it warms up after 2 months of moderate home office use. Jams when you print 2 sided.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Macky

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for me and one for my mom. It was a great decision. I planned to use mine as a back-up to my Brother color laser, but the scanning and copying functions have made this essential in my home office. The scanning is easy--I have it on my wireless network and it took me about five minutes to figure out the scan function. I also love that there's an automatic feed for copying multi-page documents. That seems like a higher-end function for such a reasonably-priced printer.
customer_reviews.author: AudreyD

customer_reviews.title: I got this last year and I am not happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I got this last year and I am not happy with it. The ink runs out so quickly. It takes forever to print. I wish I had returned it when I had the time.
customer_reviews.author: T.S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product- the value is great Like the fact I can print from my phone, desktop or laptop
customer_reviews.author: Laura Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box and pretty straight forward. It's a bit noisy but pretty standard for that price and printers.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: and kept hoping for the best with no success
customer_reviews.text: This printer has not functioned properly since the day we received it. We have completed all the troubleshooting, etc., and kept hoping for the best with no success. It will print one page of a multi-page document, get stuck, we have to abort the job, and print page by page. Our last Brother was a fantastic printer with no issues...maybe this is a Brother from another Mother.
customer_reviews.author: D

product_meta.title: Brother MFC-J4620DW, All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Wireless Connectivity, Automatic Duplex Printing, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description:
Style:MFCJ4620DW

With fast print speeds, wireless connectivity(1), and NFC capability(2), the Brother Business Smart Series MFC-J4620DW was designed for working professionals. This color inkjet all-in-one can copy, print, scan, and fax with amazing efficiency. Producing up to 22ppm for black pages and 20ppm for color(4), the MFC-J4620DW ensures you don’t have to wait a long time for prints. An added 150-sheet 8.5” x 11” paper tray and 20-sheet automatic document feeder help to provide diversity in your printing options. The Brother Business Smart Series Color All-in-One also includes a single-sheet bypass tray for larger paper sizes, including 11” x 17”.

This color inkjet all-in-one is also NFC-capable, allowing “touch to connect” printing and scanning with NFC-compatible devices(2). The touchscreen menu permits users to connect to and print from compatible mobile devices over wireless networks.(1) You can also scan documents to popular cloud-based services like Google Drive, Dropbox, and more(3).

An innovative landscape print technology feature that stores and feeds paper in a landscape orientation as a space-saving design is also included. The Brother MFC-J4620DW Color Inkjet is also Amazon Dash Replenishment enabled. Upon activation, this system allows the all-in-one to measure the ink level of your Genuine Brother Replacement Cartridges and order them directly from Amazon.com so that you never run out of ink.

(1)Requires connection to a wireless network. (2)The mobile device must have NFC capability and run Android OS 4.4 or later. (3)Requires internet connection and an account with desired service. (3) (4)Based on ISO/IEC 24734 (after first set of ISO test pages). For more details, see manufacturer’s website.
feature_bullets: WIRELESS PRINTING: The MFCJ4620DW with scanner, copier, and fax machine can connect wirelessly to mobile devices, laptops, and desktops(1).
NFC CAPABILITY: The Business Smart Series Color Inkjet All-in-One offers touch-to-connect scanning and printing ability with NFC devices(2).
WEB CONNECT SCAN: Scan documents to popular cloud-based services like Google Drive, Dropbox, Evernote, and more from the MFCJ4620DW(3).
AMAZON DASH REPLENISHMENT ENABLED: Upon activation, Amazon Dash Replenishment measures the toner level and orders more from Amazon when it’s low.
FOR USE WITH BROTHER GENUINE INKS: LC203BK, LC203C, LC203M, LC203Y, LC2033PKS, LC2032PKS, LC207BK, LC2072PKS, LC205C, LC205M, LC205Y, LC2053PKS

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars435 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
